alternative_parents.description: Polycyclic aromatic compounds containing an indole fused to a quinoline.
alternative_parents.name: Indoloquinolines

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a benzene fused to a quinoline ring system.
alternative_parents.name: Benzoquinolines

alternative_parents.description: Quinolines in which the quinoline ring system is substituted by one carboxamide group at the 3-position.
alternative_parents.name: Quinoline-3-carboxamides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a pyrroloquinoline moiety, which consists of a pyrrole ring fused to a quinoline.
alternative_parents.name: Pyrroloquinolines

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an indole moiety that carries an alkyl chain at the 3-position.
alternative_parents.name: 3-alkylindoles

alternative_parents.description: Polycyclic compounds containing an isoindole moiety, which is structurally characterized by a cyclohexadiene fused to a pyrrole ring.
alternative_parents.name: Isoindoles and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Alkylamines in which the alkyl group is substituted at one carbon atom by an aromatic hydrocarbyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Aralkylamines

alternative_parents.description: Aromatic compounds containing one or more benzene rings.
alternative_parents.name: Benzenoids

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an aromatic ring where a carbon atom is linked to an hetero atom.
alternative_parents.name: Heteroaromatic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a pyrrole ring, which is a five-member aromatic heterocycle with one nitrogen atom and four carbon atoms.
alternative_parents.name: Pyrroles

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an amide derivative of carboxylic acid, with the general structure RN(R1)C(R2)=O (R1-R2 any atom but H).
alternative_parents.name: Tertiary carboxylic acid amides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a trialkylamine group, characterized by exactly three alkyl groups bonded to the amino nitrogen.
alternative_parents.name: Trialkylamines

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an amine group, a carboxylic acid group (or a derivative thereof), and a side-chain that is specific to each amino acid.
alternative_parents.name: Amino acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one nitrogen atom and one carbon atom linked to each other.
alternative_parents.name: Azacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a carbonyl group, with the general structure RC(=O)R', where R=organyl, R'=H, N, O, organyl group or halide group.
alternative_parents.name: Carbonyl compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

class.description: Compounds containing an ergoline moiety, which is structurally characterized by he presence of a 4,6,6a,7,8,9,10,10a-octahydroindolo[4,3-fg] quinoline.
class.name: Ergoline and derivatives

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as lysergic acids and derivatives. These are alkaloids with a structure based on the lysergic acid skeleton.

direct_parent.description: Alkaloids with a structure based on the lysergic acid skeleton.
direct_parent.name: Lysergic acids and derivatives

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Alkaloids with a structure based on the lysergic acid skeleton.
subclass.name: Lysergic acids and derivatives

superclass.description: Naturally occurring chemical compounds that contain mostly basic nitrogen atoms. This group also includes some related compounds with neutral and even weakly acidic properties. Also some synthetic compounds of similar structure are attributed to alkaloids. In addition to carbon, hydrogen and nitrogen, alkaloids may also contain oxygen, sulfur and more rarely other elements such as chlorine, bromine, and phosphorus.
superclass.name: Alkaloids and derivatives
